message: Would you kindly suggest the appropriate .Net framework for a RESTful web service that has high concurrency performance ?

data.message: I think nodejs made already to visual studio right ?
actually i am using mono, making a rest server
If you're using mono for .net I see no point...

Do you have high concurrency problems? If yes, let's talk specifics, if not, do not prematurely optimize.

In .NET there are 3 options: Web API (builtin, free), Nancy Fx (free), and ServiceStack (commercial for anything serious).

They all do the job well. Web API is dominant when finding developers with skills matter. Go with it till you hit a roadblock.

I second Negm though. There is not much point in using Mono for high performance / concurrency requirements. You'll get this from IIS, but Mono isn't abused badly enough, so it doesn't have solutions to these problems, as not enough users had it.
WebAPI with good use of asynchronous programming go far enough.

WebpAPI is the standard choice now, but you have to take a look on Service Stack (v3 free) 
It's better in performance compared to WebAPI

https://github.com/ServiceStack/ServiceStack/wiki/Real-world-performance
